meanings.definition: To perform (work, tasks, etc.) in a hasty or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: She scamped through her homework without paying attention.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers scamped the repairs, causing more problems.
meanings.sent3: He scamped his chores so quickly that he forgot to feed the dog.
meanings.sent4: The chef scamped the dish, leaving out key ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The student scamped the essay, resulting in a low grade.

meanings.definition: To run or move quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: The cat scamped across the yard chasing a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: She scamped to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scamped up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: The children scamped through the park, full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit scamped away from the approaching fox.

meanings.definition: A hasty or careless piece of work.
meanings.sent1: The painting was a scamped job, with visible brush strokes.
meanings.sent2: The report was full of scamps, showing lack of attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked like a scamp, hastily put together.
meanings.sent4: The sculpture appeared to be a scamp, lacking finesse.
meanings.sent5: The repair work was a scamp, with parts falling apart quickly.
